title: Timeline pending dot
body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Customize timeline pending dot when pending is not false.

### What does the proposed API look like?
``` javascript
<Timeline
  pending={boolean|string|ReactNode}
  pendingDot={string|ReactNode}
>
</Timeline>
```

<!-- generated by ant-design-issue-helper. DO NOT REMOVE -->
author: Tarocch1

comments.body: Closed via #9546.

title: [Message] - allow selecting animation for display
body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Be able to select how Message appears: fade in; flash; bounce; etc

### What does the proposed API look like?
Argument: 'animation'

comments.body: Duplicate of #9387
I don't see how this is a duplicate.
Merged in #9580

title: Table component should support function or node as emptyText's value
author: jihgao

comments.body: PR is welcome~

title: resolve type name collisions
body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
* Type { InputProps } from 'antd/lib/auto-complete' collide with { InputProps } from 'antd/lib/input'
* rename { SearchProps } from 'antd/lib/transfer' collide with { SearchProps } from 'antd/lib/input'



### What does the proposed API look like?
* rename { InputProps } from 'antd/lib/auto-complete' to { AutoCompleteInputProps }
* rename { SearchProps } from 'antd/lib/transfer' to { TransferSearchProps }

<!-- generated by ant-design-issue-helper. DO NOT REMOVE -->
author: hackape

comments.body: Why they are conflicting? These interfaces in different module.
@hackape Can I work on this?
@GauravV-02 Yes, but can you answer my question?

@yesmeck I haven't looked it why its conflicting yet. Lets think we have a module where I have to import both the interfaces from input and auto complete, It will give an duplicate identifier error because the names of the interfaces are same.
Hmm, make sense. welcome PR.

Sorry guys I totally missed out this thread. 

@GauravV-02 yes that's exactly the case I ran into, I made a module layer that functions as a customization point, which effectively import, extend, then re-export everything. At the time I check, it's already merged, thank you for you effort.

title: Add ids to form related components ( date input fields, radio buttons and checkboxes, dropdowns, etc)
body:
### What problem does this feature solve? It makes it easy to do end-to-end testing using Selinium and xPath ### What does the proposed API look like? For example a code like this: `` should give in the compiled code something like this: ``` ...
... ``` Thank you very much for the great job you are doing!
author: TimMisikos

comments.body: Adding ids won't work for all components. Let's say Select component, a simplest Select component doesn't render input, you can not assign a value to input to change Select's value.

@yesmeck thank you for giving me more information regarding this issue, so is there any other way around that you are aware? Do you know any other tools which would work well for end-to-end testing? is this going to work on the antd@3? If no... at least we will be able to read pre-populated values.

As far as I could see, there is currently no way to pass any kind of id to the input field with the class '.ant-calendar-input'.
I will have a look into the rc-calendar module.

Adding an `id` to input fields (even inside components like `DatePicker`) is important for accessibility reasons. I want to add an `htmlFor` to associated labels, and focus the input fields when I click the labels.
PR anytime if you find any component doesn't support id.
I'm using uilicious.com for my UI testing and it's very challenging when IDs are not present.
for cypress output rc_select_1 , its random dynamic for all dropdown / `ant select`

> for cypress output rc_select_1 , its random dynamic for all dropdown / `ant select`

```
<input autocomplete="off" class="ant-select-selection-search-input" role="combobox" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-owns="rc_select_2_list" aria-autocomplete="list" aria-controls="rc_select_2_list" type="search" value="" id="rc_select_2">
```

for select only its. correct as default `id_status` 
```
<input id="id_status" autocomplete="off" class="ant-select-selection-search-input" role="combobox" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-owns="id_status_list" aria-autocomplete="list" aria-controls="id_status_list" aria-required="true" type="search" value="" aria-describedby="id_status_help" aria-invalid="true">
```

title: DatePicker - picker to go away on enter
body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
More user-friendlyâ€‹ (intuitive)

### What does the proposed API look like?
As for now, the DatePicker allows the user to input the date by himself, but on the Enter press the date is selected, but the picker is still there. Wouldn't it be nice to just hide the picker if a user decides to enter the date manually and confirm it by pressing enter?

<!-- generated by ant-design-issue-helper. DO NOT REMOVE -->
author: mb8z

comments.body: We have no time to improve keyboard accessibility, but PR is welcomed, thanks.
@benjycui @yesmeck  some update in rc-calendar, need your advices. thx
It will close Picker when press enter now.

title: [Feature Request about site] place 'search...' at the bottom of the search options
body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Improve user experience.

While searching, relevent componets should be placed before 'search in google'.

### What does the proposed API look like?
ant-design/site/theme/template/Layout/Header.jsx

#230 - #233

```javascript
{options}
<Option value={searchEngine} data-label={searchEngine}>
       <FormattedMessage id="app.header.search" />
</Option>
```

title: English version of the sketch file

### What problem does this feature solve?
Font sizes, line heights, symbols etc won't be broken when changing Chinese logograms to English letters. Also English version of symbols' names, layers and artboards would make the file so much easier and more understandable to use.

### What does the proposed API look like?
Just translate every word from Chinese to English.

title: Notification doesn't support customize style
body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
when description is long and with split line, like :  

[WARNING]  
[INFO]  
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------  
[INFO] Building ***  
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------  

I want to customize the style.

### What does the proposed API look like?
    notification.success({
      style : { width: 300},
      message: 'my title',
      description: 'a long long string'
    })

<!-- generated by ant-design-issue-helper. DO NOT REMOVE -->
author: lixiaoyang1992

comments.body: If you accept the feature, I can PR

And how about `message`? 

And, if we accept this feature, we had better to support `className`, too.

According to Notification API, message means title.

And of coerce, we should support className.
The conclusion is that we need to add `style` and `className` to `antd.notification` `antd.message`
@lixiaoyang1992 could you PR to add these features?
OK

title: Enable customizing margin-bottom property of ant-tabs-bar style of Tabs component
body:
Hello,

The margin-bottom property of the bar of the _Tabs_ component is fixed to 16px. It will be useful to allow modify this proportion with a property of the compoment or, at least, with a less variable. 

Best regards.
author: aaronplanell

comments.body:
Actually, you can override it by CSS selector now.

Or you can PR to add a LESS variable.
Maybe we can add a `tabBarStyle` prop for this?
Thanks a lot @afc163 !!! :racehorse: How fast!!! :smile:
Will be released in antd@2.8.0 by the end of February.
This thread has been automatically locked because it has not had recent activity. Please open a new issue for related bugs and link to relevant comments in this thread.

title: Modal afterClose does not pass event
body:
afterClose function does not pass the event argument. 
Similarly Popconfirm onConfirm, onCancel does not pass the event.

event.stopPropagation() needed to be called on both the above handlers but event not passed.
author: SamyukthaJ

comments.body:
`afterClose` just indicates that the closing action has been completed, you can use `onOk` `onCancel` in Modal.

And the event argument has been left out in these handlers:

- Modal: `onOk` 
- Popconfirm: `onConfirm ` `onCancel `

Could you give us a PR to fix it? ğŸ˜ƒ
@SamyukthaJ
This thread has been automatically locked because it has not had recent activity. Please open a new issue for related bugs and link to relevant comments in this thread.

title: tabs/index.d.ts lacks of Â className & disabled
body:
#### Environment(required)

- antd version: 2.7.0
- OS and its version: mac 10.11
- Browser and its version: chrome 55

#### What did you do? Please provide steps to re-produce your problem.
````tsx
<Tabs.TabPane tab="å¿«" key="k" className={'c1'} disabled></Tabs.TabPane>
````
Error:(24, 13) TS2324:Property '**className disabled**' is missing in type 'IntrinsicAttributes & IntrinsicClassAttributes<Component<TabPaneProps, ComponentState>> & { child...'.

#### What do you expected?

export interface TabPaneProps {
    /** é€‰é¡¹å¡å¤´æ˜¾ç¤ºæ–‡å­— */
    tab?: React.ReactNode | string;
    style?: React.CSSProperties;
    className?: string; // æ·»åŠ è¿™ä¸ª
    disabled?: boolean; // æ·»åŠ è¿™ä¸ª
}

#### What happen?
tsc error

title: components height is hardcoded
body:
Hi guys,

I use a 14px default font-size in my project and the following components have their height hardcoded, it would be good to use the ```@input-height-base```, ```@input-height-lg``` and ```@input-height-base```.

Affected components are:
- Select (line 161)
- Radio (line 140)
- Switch (line 11, 57)

Thanks for the fix ;)
author: pierre-b

comments.body: A PR is welcomed, and we will publish a patch in this weekend.
This thread has been automatically locked because it has not had recent activity. Please open a new issue for related bugs and link to relevant comments in this thread.

title: [feature request] adjusting the InputNumber component value by scrolling the mouse
body:
When our cursor is hanging up on the InputNumber component,
it's best if we can change the value of it by scrolling up or down the scroller.
